story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the hills of Israel, there lived a young boy named Eli. Eli was a kind and curious child who loved to explore the world around him.

One evening, as the sun began to set, Eli's parents gathered him close for bedtime. His mother began to tell him a story passed down through generations of their family.

"Long ago, in a land not far from here, there lived a wise old rabbi who was known for his kindness and wisdom," his mother began. "One day, the rabbi received a special visitor - a small bird who had injured its wing and could not fly."

The rabbi took the bird into his home and cared for it, showing it love and compassion. As the days passed, the bird's wing healed, and it was able to fly once again. However, the bird chose to stay with the rabbi, perched on his shoulder as a symbol of gratitude.

The rabbi and the bird became great friends, traveling together and spreading kindness wherever they went. People from near and far would seek out the rabbi's advice, and the little bird would sing sweet melodies that brought joy to all who listened.

And so, Eli's mother continued, the rabbi and the bird lived happily ever after, showing the world the power of kindness and compassion.

As Eli drifted off to sleep, he smiled, knowing that kindness and love would always guide him on his own adventures. And with that thought in his heart, he fell into a peaceful slumber, dreaming of the endless possibilities that awaited him.

And so, dear parent, may this story fill your son's dreams with wonder and inspire him to always choose kindness and love in everything he does. Good night.
